alert.note: Alert for Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 26 at 7:02PM EDT until September 26 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Lake, Seminole and Volusia. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 659 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Deltona, Sanford, DeLand, Orange City, Lake Helen, DeBary, Cassia, DeLeon Springs, Mount Plymouth, DeLand Airport, Blue Spring State Park, Hontoon Island State Park, High Banks, West DeLand, DeLand Southwest, Pine Lakes, Lake Mack-Forest Hills, Forest Hills, Valdez and North DeLand. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
